fields.customfield_17901: Issue: When passport # and COI are entered, then saved and viewed on Confirmation page - then the user goes Back, removes Passport # which then removes the COI, and user saves and continues, the COI is still on the Confirmation page. The COI should not be there (same as passport # is no longer there). Sent back to In Progress.
fields.description: As a General User or Supervisor User I need to have a confirmation screen so that I can review what I have entered

comments.body:
Technical details / tasks:
* Retain data (first from initiate case page, pass data back to initiate case page when hitting the back button)
* Data fields on confirmation page are read only

Est Medium size

Task: React component that passes information that passes to a new component in a read-only manner
Task: Apply Styles: use Erland's approach to organize style in React
Use Native Bootstrap styles, limit custom CSS

*Note: Layout of fields may change. Be flexible as possible.

Estimated points: Medium Plus

508 Violation:
- Page needs a title attribute

work remaining to be done:
- I-94 alien number issue
- 508 fix
- title card for additional requests shows even when 
back button does not auto populate the initiate case screen.

third bullet correction from prior comment:
- title card should not display when additional requests are not present.
- back button goes all the way back to login that is why it isn't populating.

Issue: When passport # and COI are entered, then saved and viewed on Confirmation page - then the user goes Back, removes Passport # which then removes the COI, and user saves and continues, the COI is still on the Confirmation page. The COI should not be there (same as passport # is no longer there). Sent back to In Progress.

fields.customfield_17901:
We have a functioning local (OSX) development environment for each app in SAVE MOD. Pending the finalization of Docker images/containers, the team is proceeding with this arrangement:
npm for React development within save-app/front-end/, with an editor preference for Visual Studio Code.

Generic Ruby on Rails development within save-app/.

IntelliJ / Gradle for Java Spring development in save-spring-api/.

Comments on how to get this development env running have been added to the READMEs.
fields.description: Dev Ops to setup dev env

comments.body:
We have a functioning local (OSX) development environment for each app in SAVE MOD. Pending the finalization of Docker images/containers, the team is proceeding with this arrangement:
npm for React development within save-app/front-end/, with an editor preference for Visual Studio Code.

Generic Ruby on Rails development within save-app/.

IntelliJ / Gradle for Java Spring development in save-spring-api/.

Comments on how to get this development env running have been added to the READMEs.

fields.customfield_17901:
Instructions to access and run legacy code in TECC Test environment:

https://git.uscis.dhs.gov/USCIS/save-app/wiki/TECC-Test-Environment-Setup

Details of the ESB calls (external service calls to DOJ, ADIS, SEVIS and other systems) that are part of the legacy SAVE logic are being documented along with document type uses under SM-91. Refer to documentation generated for SM-91 for findings.
fields.description:
# Are ESB calls made through a stored procedure? 
# Do we need to integrate with the ESB server or not? (external system calls)
#    If we do, where does the integration occur? 
# How does this affect performance? 

Output: Determine what is needed to run the stored procedures. 
(For ADIS Check, Removal Order, IJ Decision Table)

Work out with VariQ to walk us through the stored procedure: need an explanation on the parameters that were gathered.
Debug in Visual Studio


Timebox of One Day with VariQ assistance- Brian


Keep in mind, the end goal is to evaluate two hypotheses:
1. Removing the Document Type does not break or incorrectly bias the current algorithm
2. Allowing more enumerators results in more matches in 1st Step.  Subsequently *fewer* cases go to 2nd/3rd Step.

comments.body:
Instructions to access and run legacy code in TECC Test environment:

https://git.uscis.dhs.gov/USCIS/save-app/wiki/TECC-Test-Environment-Setup

Details of the ESB calls (external service calls to DOJ, ADIS, SEVIS and other systems) that are part of the legacy SAVE logic are being documented along with document type uses under SM-91. Refer to documentation generated for SM-91 for findings.

fields.customfield_17901:
Results of the spike: There were many discussions about the use of document type during initial verification. In summary: 

There must be a doc type when we submit to produce initial verification using the stored procedures because the stored procedures require it. However, the process flow when the enumerators are interrogated does not depend on doc type – it depends on the enumerators. There is significant work done to produce an initial verification and removing doc type at this time has not been proven to be enough of a gain to warrant the delay in MVP. 

Further, the document type is used in reporting. We are not investigating how reporting is done or looking at it for modernization at this time. This will need to be investigated before altering how the doc type is managed in the system.
fields.description:
Map out the business logic to determine whether using 'Other' document type negatively biases the verification result. 

Goal: How to make sure we give the same verification response using only Other doc type as legacy does using different doc types?

# Determine what kind of end-to-end tests do we need, what are the use cases. 
# How do we mock out the ESB calls? 
# Can we test what external services are being called and how many times? 


Need test structures, walk through the process, and understand what returns a positive result.
Would like VariQ to step through both VM-90 and VM-91

Go through TECCS with Rama and get specific questions for VariQ.
2 Days (Dr. Dan)
fields.summary: Research - Test using 'Other' doc type with verification result

comments.body: Rama, Chris, Lana, Brian, Muse, Dan do a 2 day spike on TECCS.
Will review the write-up from Rama, Dan and Brian

Results of the spike: There were many discussions about the use of document type during initial verification. In summary: 

There must be a doc type when we submit to produce initial verification using the stored procedures because the stored procedures require it. However, the process flow when the enumerators are interrogated does not depend on doc type – it depends on the enumerators. There is significant work done to produce an initial verification and removing doc type at this time has not been proven to be enough of a gain to warrant the delay in MVP. 

Further, the document type is used in reporting. We are not investigating how reporting is done or looking at it for modernization at this time. This will need to be investigated before altering how the doc type is managed in the system.

Endpoint Name:

Scenario: After a user clicks the "initiate verification" button and the applicant information is run through the algorithm, the system displays the result in a Post Response

AC:
Input Groupings:
* Document Type "Other"
* Applicant Information
* Document Information (Fields are listed in the file from the link below)
https://sharedservices.dhs.gov/confluence/display/SM/SAVE+Validation
* Requested Benefits
* Additional Requests

Get POST response Error Message

Display response on plain screen
Verbiage - Title: UNABLE TO PROCESS
text: "This case could not be processed due to a technical error. This does not mean that the applicant is ineligible to receive a public benefit or license from your agency. Close this case by clicking Resolve Case and then create a new case from the SAVE Home page. 

To return to the SAVE Home Page, click the Home icon on the top navigation menu."

Tasks:
Validation on inputs

fields.customfield_17901: Instead of displaying the response on a plain screen to show the system was down, we will display the stored procedure's error message in a modal window. The logonId will purposefully be left out of the call to guarantee the error message.
fields.description: As a General User I need to submit a case for verification so that I can verify an applicant's ID

comments.body:
Technical details / tasks:
* POST data
* Research expected response - where is it coming from, what data is being returned, what format, and how do we need to handle it?
* Need to understand business logic run in legacy before stored proc / algorithm is called on submission (emails and meeting requests to VariQ already outstanding)

Est story size Large

Tasks from Technical Planning:
First post with a database call
Successfully connected all 3 layers of the application
Try to hit stored procedure; Code in "System Unavailable" to show error message

Tasks:
Build in Error Handling
Post data to Rails
Post to Java to get error message
Attempt to call 1st stored procedure (May get a case number back from 1st stored procedure)

Instead of displaying the response on a plain screen to show the system was down, we will display the stored procedure's error message in a modal window. The logonId will purposefully be left out of the call to guarantee the error message.

fields.customfield_17901: VariQ is able to access the elasticache from their side and store a value, which we are subsequently able to retrieve.
fields.description:
Get port open
Set up Elasticache to AWS

Be able to pull data from Redis

Muse to take point
fields.summary: Proof of Concept for Redis Cache Sharing Session

comments.body:
Working elasticache proof of concept up on AWS currently.  Screenshot attached of final commands needed to access the cache from a redis-cli.  

As we talked to Josh, this is not an infrastructure-as-code solution for an elasticache in SAVE.  Setting this up would be future DevOps work.  This is just a proof to start working with Variq.

Further reading on connecting to nodes: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/UserGuide/GettingStarted.ConnectToCacheNode.html

Furthering reading on redis gem for Ruby, which includes creating connections within our own code:
https://github.com/redis/redis-rb
VariQ is able to access the elasticache from their side and store a value, which we are subsequently able to retrieve.

When the <user> selects a log-in ID

Note: this header will appear on all screens

<user>:
General User
Supervisor User

Here are the links as they are in staging, left to right: 
*Initiate Case*: This will be our mod link
*Search Cases*: https://stage-save-release.uscis.dhs.gov/web/CaseSearch.aspx
*Reports*: https://stage-save-release.uscis.dhs.gov/web/cpshome.aspx#
*Resources*: https://stage-save-release.uscis.dhs.gov/web/cpshome.aspx#
*Signout*: https://stage-save-release.uscis.dhs.gov/web/vislogin.aspx?JS=YES (the Use Agreement page before login, with a message at the top stating "You have been successfully been logged out")
*SAVE Logo*: the link is to the root of the beta site app
